content.1: And Balaam said unto Balak, Build me here seven altars, and prepare me here seven oxen and seven rams.
content.2: And Balak did as Balaam had spoken; and Balak and Balaam offered on

content.4: And God met Balaam: and he said unto him, I have prepared seven altars, and I have offered upon
content.6: And he returned unto him, and, lo, he stood by his burnt sacrifice, he, and all the princes of Moab.
content.7: And he took up his parable, and said, Balak the king of Moab hath brought me from Aram, out of the mountains of the east,
content.8: How shall I curse, whom God hath not cursed? or how shall I defy,
content.9: For from the top of the rocks I see him, and from the hills I behold him: lo, the people shall dwell alone, and shall not be reckoned among the nations.

content.12: And he answered and said, Must I not take heed to speak that which the
content.13: And Balak said unto him, Come, I pray thee, with me unto another place, from whence thou mayest see them: thou shalt see but the utmost part of them, and shalt not see them all: and curse me them from thence.

content.18: And he took up his parable, and said, Rise up, Balak, and hear; hearken unto me, thou son of Zippor:
content.21: He hath not beheld iniquity in Jacob, neither hath he seen perverseness in Israel: the
content.22: God brought them out of Egypt; he hath as it were the strength of an unicorn.

content.25: And Balak said unto Balaam, Neither curse them at all, nor bless them at all.

content.27: And Balak said unto Balaam, Come, I pray thee, I will bring thee unto another place; peradventure it will please God that thou mayest curse me them from thence.
content.28: And Balak brought Balaam unto the top of Peor, that looketh toward Jeshimon.
content.29: And Balaam said unto Balak, Build me here seven altars, and prepare me here seven bullocks and seven rams.
